title: Pea Ridge National Military Park: Park Home
body: The Battle That Saved Missouri For The Union  On March 7-8, 1862, 26,000 soldiers fought here to decide the fate of Missouri and the West.Â  The 4,300 acre battlefield honors those who fought for their beliefs. Pea Ridge was one of the most pivotal Civil War battles and is the most intact Civil War battlefield in the United States. Read More             North or South?    The National Park Service has developed a great tool listing millions of soldiers, North and South. Discover your family's history today.
